alert.note: Alert for San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 22 at 11:22AM PST until January 22 at 12:45PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON FOR COAST AND WESTERN VALLEYS OF SAN DIEGO COUNTY... * WHAT...Areas of flooding caused by moderate to locally heavy rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including northern San Diego coast, the western valleys of San Diego County, and the southern portion of the Santa Ana mountains in Orange county. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water on roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1117 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated moderate to locally heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing and is expected to continue into the afternoon. Between 0.75 and 1.75 inches of rain have fallen in the past 6 hours, locally 2 to 2.25 inches in some locations near the coast. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area through this afternoon. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chula Vista, Oceanside, Carlsbad, El Cajon, Vista, Encinitas, National City, La Mesa, Poway and Imperial Beach. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
